newsitem.title: USA: NIMO 610 MW N.Y. nuke in startup mode.
newsitem.headline: NIMO 610 MW N.Y. nuke in startup mode.

text.p: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp's 610 megawatt Nine Mile Point nuclear power unit 1 in Scriba, N.Y., was restarting operations Tuesday after being shut for repairs, Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said.
The unit's reactor was critical and restart had begun as of early Tuesday, NRC said in its daily plant status report.
Nine Mile Point 1 tripped off line November 5 following a generator malfunction.
The adjoining 1,137 megawatt Nine Mile Point nuclear power unit 2 was operating normally at 100 percent of capacity as of early Tuesday, the NRC said.
The Nine Mile Point units are operated by Niagara Mohawk, which holds 100 percent ownership of unit 1 and has a 41 percent stake in unit 2.
